name: Entra ID Application & Service Principal Abuse
description: MITRE ATT&CK mapping for securing, detecting, and investigating abuse of Entra ID applications and service principals using Defender XDR.

techniques.comment: Stolen service principal credentials used for non-interactive authentication.
Theft or abuse of OAuth access tokens issued to Entra ID applications.
Account manipulation via application or service principal modification.
Credentials added to a high-privilege service principal to establish persistence.
Creation of new applications or service principals to maintain long-term access.
Alternate authentication material used by applications to bypass MFA.
Private key or certificate theft associated with Entra ID applications.
Account enumeration via Microsoft Graph using compromised app permissions.
Discovery of directory roles and groups via Microsoft Graph APIs.
Email collection performed by compromised applications using Exchange APIs.
Data collection from SharePoint or OneDrive using Graph permissions.
Large-scale data transfer to attacker-controlled cloud storage.
Graph and REST API usage over HTTPS from anomalous ASN or geography.
Indirect impact via application-enabled destructive actions.
